| population_note = | timezone1 = [[Eastern European Time|EET]] | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = [[Eastern European Summer Time|EEST]] | utc_offset1_DST = +3 | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = | area_code_type = [[Telephone numbers in Lebanon|Dialing code]] | area_code = +961 | website = http://www.kaftoun.com/ | footnotes = }} '''Kaftoun''' ({{lang-ar|كفتون}}) is a small Lebanese village located along the north bank of the Walnut River, in the [[Koura District]], North [[Lebanon]]. The population of the village is approximately three-hundred, spread around seventy-four houses. They are mostly of [[Greek Orthodox Christianity in Lebanon|Greek Orthodox]] ancestry.<ref>{{cite web|title=Municipal and ikhtiyariah elections in Northern Lebanon |url=http://www.localiban.org/IMG/pdf/iiMonthly-Municip-Mar10-E92.pdf |publisher=The Monthly |accessdate=1 November 2016 |page=23 |date=March 2010 |url-status=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160603040803/http://www.localiban.org/IMG/pdf/iiMonthly-Municip-Mar10-E92.pdf |archivedate= 3 June 2016 }}</ref> The village is famous for the Moussa-Georges family.<ref>[http://www.kifraya.com/default.htm Kifraya website]</ref> The name "Kaftoun" in the ancient [[Aramaic language]] means "dug from" or "sculpted from" a cliff and also (Kftuna) could means "the domed".
Semaan (سمعان) is the biggest family in Kaftoun.
Both roots of the word lead us to believe that the village of Kaftoun was named after the domed Theotokos Monastery<ref>[http://www.kaftoun.com/gallery?func=viewcategory&section=kaftoun&catid=71&section_id=1 Photo Gallery]. Kaftoun. Retrieved on October 12, 2011.</ref> which is carved in the red rock cliffs by the banks of the Jaouz River.
Kaftoun has three historic churches:<ref>[http://www.kaftoun.com/component/content/article/79-church/92 Kaftoun Churchs]. Kaftoun.com (6 November 2004). Retrieved on October 12, 2011.</ref> Saint Phocas Church (Mar Foka's<ref>[http://www.kaftoun.com/gallery?func=viewcategory&section=kaftoun&catid=95&section_id=1 Photo Gallery]. Kaftoun. Retrieved on October 12, 2011.</ref>), the Church of Saint Sergius and Bacchus (Mar Sarkis<ref>[http://www.kaftoun.com/gallery?func=viewcategory&section=kaftoun&catid=92&section_id=1 Photo Gallery]. Kaftoun. Retrieved on October 12, 2011.</ref>) 6th century, and the most famed Theotokos Monastery,<ref>[http://www.kaftoun.com/component/content/article/71:village-articles/98:the-kaftoun-theotokos-monastery-a-jewel-of-spirituality The Kaftoun Theotokos Monastery - a jewel of spirituality!]. Kaftoun.com (30 March 2005). Retrieved on October 12, 2011.</ref> which houses a two-sided Byzantine icon<ref>[http://www.ortmtlb.org.lb/theotokos.htm Kaftoun's Theotokos] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060424080511/http://www.ortmtlb.org.lb/theotokos.htm |date=2006-04-24 }}. Ortmtlb.org.lb. Retrieved on October 12, 2011.</ref> from the 11th century.
